result.execSummary:
The defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:16 p.m. Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire provided. State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor Theft, Count 2 to Criminal Trespass to Dwelling violating 943.14, a Misdemeanor and to amend Information to add Count 3 - Criminal Damage to Property violating 943.01, a Misdemeanor - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.  Voorhees statement to plea colleqy - files statement from mental health provider. Voorhees statement to defendant's understandings of plea. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig files Victim Impact Statement. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Restitution - $3,965.00 (does not include 10% surcharge)
PO to establish reasonable monthly amount for payment of restitution
Comply with any mental health treatment/after care
Take all medications as prescribed and only in dosage/manner as prescribed. 
Jail credit - 31 days
Any other conditions/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:43 p.m.

5:09 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states defendant is in Shawano County jail and will be removed to Brown County for a jury trial. Parties stipulate to adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

04:06 pm - Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bednar states a resolution is not yet in place.  Voorhees requests adjournment of pretrial.  Court grants one more pretial conference.  Voohees address possible change of plea to not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court will grant one more pretrial conference.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant should not go to complaining witnesses residence without permisision rec'd in writing from the victim.   nd $6500 surety bond component - mother to sign - must live with mother and must comply with mental health settlement agreement.

09:28 am - Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calles Philip Schmidt, Three Lakes PD Officer, Sworn/Direct by Bednar - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Voorhees.  Voorhees motion to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  State files Information.  Voorhees raises possible competency issues.  Voohrees in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Voorhees statement to bond modification.  Court modifies bond - Defendant should not go to complaining witnesses residence without permisision rec'd in writing from the victim.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
and $6500 surety bond component - mother to sign - must live with mother and must comply with mental health settlement agreement

02:35 pm - Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in court, via video,  with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.  Voorhees/Bednar statement to modify bail.  Currently set at $7500 cash bond.  Court modifies bond to $1,000.00 cash and then mother to sign as surety for the remaining $6500.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

02:00 pm - Defendant Christina L. McDaniel-Rose in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
